column5: Hey MRM,  I can sympathise with you, my boat was under water all day, NE blows right over the trasnsom and the NE wind was howling at 40kmh plus all day with heavy rain.  Went out this afternoon and stood in my chest waders trying to lift the transom whilst bilge pump was on, but water was crashing over faster than the little pump i installed from CT could empty it.  I gave up after 1 hour, waves had come over the top of my waders too so totaly soaked through, so glad there was a howling wind cuz i was cursing at the top of my lungs and dont think my neighbours could here me over the wind. I'm normally pretty good watching weather report and getting it out before it hits(i dont have a dock to moor it to) but was totally sidetracked these last 2 days with news of wife's pregnancy and work.....lol...i think i was more stressed about the boat than anything else!!! Luckily the motor was not underwater....but its stressful....boy is it stressful...specially since once its under not much ya can do about it.
Yep you and the people that built the Titanic were both wrong... They'll all sink  Good luck with the repairs
Should have kicked it...  Karma is a good thing.
Buddy came over this morning and we got it fired up.........  Ran perfect all day  Think i may have gotten lucky.........
MRM,  so how did he get it going? Was the merc service manual right?  forrest

A buddy showed up and did basically what merc manual said yes........  Didnt take him that long to get it going...  about 15mins or so....  ran bad at start then was fine in about 10mins or running......  All seems to be fine............ we fished with it all day to...
So far seems to be.........  See how it runs tommorow though.  battery is toast by the looks of it.
Ok then i should fire this motor up.......   OK post update when i get back in..........
5) Change engine oil and filter<<<<run for short time and check for water again...redo if required
np.....I knew this service manual would come in handy........this forum is great for this emergency type stuff.  forrest

Ah,...didn't see the details and didn't know it was going on now.  I hope it starts for you, it'll save you a whack of money for the rebuild.   You'd be surprised to see how fast the high carbon metals start rust like the rings and sleeves.    I guess nobody here had a dirt bike or 3-4 wheeler when they were young?  I can't count the number of times i went through a stream that was a little deeper than i thought.
